Be sure to register on our website http://www.aardwolfboot.com

and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P
Don't forget our clan skills:
mutare (double / half the weight of an item) 
napalm (str and int buff) 
Always read your notes on the Personal Board, as well as Announce and Mudinfo.

CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
A Harem Alcove
  What was once a large window faces south here, the interior shutters holding 
fast against the heavy weight of sand outside. The window is set back quite a
ways into the wall, leaving room for a lounging area that is large enough to 
go past a window-seat into a window-bed. An empty birdcage hangs from the 
arched ceiling in front of the window, its door broken off and missing.
Soft, luxurious pillows line the ground and the lounging area, the colorful 
silks having faded with time.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north ]
     A pillow of faded silks rests against the shuttered window.
A rasping screech sounds from the ceiling as a skeletal bird circles above.
A woman stands near a cushion, frozen in time as she moves to sit.
A woman stands near a cushion, frozen in time as she moves to sit.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (774)

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Into the dark (G)
  You have entered a room of nothingness; there is no sound, no breeze, no
sign of life whatsoever, just a large dark hole.  This hole is said to lead
to a world of eternal darkness that is sure to drive you mad if you wander
through it for too long.  

<MAPEND>

Abstract Topological Space - The Demon's Reflection (G)
  Anyar, a crazy transmuter, once stole an entire gallery of abstract and
surrealist art, only to bring it to life.  Horrified at finding the works
she stole animated, the gallery owners instead forced her to teleport them
out into space.  These things now sprawl out across many sectors of space. 
This work shows a man with neat black hair and a small moustache looking
into a pool of water, where his reflection is that of a demon.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]

Before the Moonrift (G)
  Sometimes mistaken for a blue star, this is the entrance to a nexus
created by the three moons of Andolor.  Here the penumbrae of their magics
overlap, creating a passage between Vidblain and another world.  How this
magic works is unclear, but you can always attempt to enter the moonrift if
you wish to find out.  

<MAPEND>

A Ship's Bow (G)
  You are aboard a partially submerged sailing ship that has met with 
misfortune in the Sendhian Sea. The foundering ship is not yet abandoned, as 
all around you, chaos reigns. Sailors of the ship run about the deck, some 
with purpose, and some without. The scene is that of the last few minutes 
before the ship plunges forever into the depths of the sea.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south ]

Valley of the Snake (742)

A Raft (G)
  A raft has been pulled onto the beach here by someone. Given the lack
of any sign of a village on this part of the island, it is probable that
this particular someone came from another, nearby island, to do some 
hunting.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west other ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 518/518 HP  553/553 MP  741/778 mv  1342tnl  
Lv 17  G 43958 | A Raft (NSW*)
>>

------------------------------------------------------------
You push off and jump onto the raft as it begins to float into the sea.  After being tossed by winds
and waves, you find land once again.
------------------------------------------------------------
The Beach
  Reaching shallow water, you have grounded your raft to find yourself on a 
deserted beach. The waves lap at your feet, as you peruse your surroundings.
A path through the dunes leads eastwards towards dry land. As you turn to 
secure your raft, you find that it has been picked up by the waves, and has 
floated away.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east ]
A sheep munches quietly on grass.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Lv 17  G 44142 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Approaching a port city (734)

Brightsea Wharf (G)
  The wharf is at the epicenter of business and trade for Brightsea. Here, 
ships bring goods from afar to trade with the local merchants. These 
individuals also have standing agreements with the craftsmen of the undercity
of Glimmerdim, and do their best to make a good profit for both.

<MAPEND>

The entrance to Glimmerdim
  You stand at the entrance to the Undercity Glimmerdim. You may have heard 
tell of it from the locals, and from excursion organizers, or you may merely 
have stumbled upon it, by yourself. In any case, here it is! The entrance is 
dark and ominous. Perhaps it is dangerous below, or merely appears to be so.

The Petrified Forest
  The edge of the forest meets the cavern wall here. Several trees are 
semi-revealed from the stone cavern walls, seemingly caught somehow in 
midstep away from oblivion. These trees all lack leaves, as such things are 
far too ephemeral to be frozen in time.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Before A Vast Prairie
  This is a continuation of the prairie you just left.  Something is
different here though.  There is a mist that hangs over the ground obscuring
the brown, wheat-like grass.  The wind is still, yet the fog swirls as if
there is something hidden in the mist.  Off in the distance, even in this
foggy setting, dark shapes rise from the flat prairie.

Dragon nursery
  This appears to be a large open plan nursery environment, where
hatchlings of all metallic hues seem to intermingle at will under the
supervision of some other races who appear to be responsible for their
well-being.  Some of the hatchlings seem to be able to smell the fresh air
blowing in from the tunnel to the south, and are constantly making bids for
freedom in that direction, only to be gently discouraged by an elf, who
picks them up, pets them for a while, then pushes them north.  

<MAPEND>

e
Piles of hatchlings
  A large pile of tiny dragons of all metallic hues seem to be engaged in a 
free-for-all wrestling match, with much play biting and clawing and an 
occasional tiny burst of flame or gas. It doesn't seem a good place to stand 
for long unless you are wearing especially thick boots, as it looks like some
of the "playing" would do a fair bit of damage to anything not covered in 
dragonscale, albeit very immature dragonscale.

hatchlings of all metallic hues seem to intermingle at will under the
supervision of some other races who appear to be responsible for their
well-being.  Some of the hatchlings seem to be able to smell the fresh air

[*Daily Blessing*] 369/518 HP  370/553 MP  777/778 mv  789tnl  
Lv 17  G 44183 | Dragon nursery (NESW)
>>
e
Centre of the nursery
  In the centre of this open-planned cavern, the cheeping and squeaklike roars 
of the hatchlings are almost deafening. Distant corners of the cavern are 
occasionally lit by a hatchling's breath, which most closely resembles a 
matchflare in the distance at night. Some of the hatchlings tumble around at 
your feet, and an occasional overexcited one leaps into the air and attempts 
to flap its wings and fly. As yet, none of these beasts have the requisite 
wingspan, so they tumble to the floor and squeak in pain, then get up and 
dust themselves off and go back to playing.

<MAPEND>

Feeding time
  Hatchlings waddle around here, flapping their wings with excitement and
drooling with hunger.  Dismembered goats are distributed in suitably tiny
bite sized portions by some of the minders who wander around caring for the
little beasts.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

A Path at the Foot of a Mountain

to the north. The tree branches are knobby with short needles that scratch 
you as you walk the trail. The air is crisp, and the oxygen thin as you 
follow the trail through the woods. The path leads north and east from here.

east and west form here and the row leads south.

The Casbah

city towering over you.  You hear the scraping sounds of metal on stone and

lies the intersection on Guildsman's Row and the northern gate is a short

s
Guildsman's Row
  This row is a hive of activity second only to the actual market square
itself.  Along this row stands all the guilds of the working class citizens
of New Thalos; here all the items sold in the square are made.  Along this
particular stretch of the row lie the Boyer/ Fletcher to the west and the
Mason's to the east.  The row leads off to the south and East Casbah is to
the north.

The Boyer/Fletcher's
  The walls in this room are covered with pegs that hold various types of
bows.  There are few people working here, lending to the fact that the
skills are rare to come by in the general populous.  A few boys are busy in
the corner preparing feathers for the fine shafts used in making arrows. 
Some Elven craftsmen are carefuly inspecting each bow as it is finished.

Guildsman's Row
  This row is a hive of activity second only to the actual market square

of New Thalos; here all the items sold in the square are made.  Along this

Mason's to the east.  The row leads off to the south and East Casbah is to
the north.

The Dancing Daemon Inn
  A huge circling wet-bar takes up most of the east end of the Daemon.  An
old mage reclines against the mirror behind the bar absentmindedly pouring
several drinks at once with his refined telekinesis.  The Lokettes, a local

partying here.  The only obvious exit is to the north.

sounds, those known only to the New Thalos market, barrage your senses.  The
only hope of making any sense of what's going on here is to wander around. 
The Market continues north, west, and east, with the Medina trailing off
south.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
A small grey-haired man walks around spouting gospel.
An elite royal guard stands here smiling happily.
A small harmless feline searches for food.

[*Daily Blessing*] 354/518 HP  405/553 MP  773/778 mv  476tnl  
Lv 17  G 44250 | The Southern Market Square (NESW)
>>
e
The Southeastern Market Square
  In this corner of the market some of the largest warriors in the land
tower over you.  It's easy to understand why they hangout here once you
notice the weapon shop and the armory close by.  Perhaps you might stop in
and take a look at the wares these shops have to offer.

The Eastern Market Square
  You stand in the market of New Thalos, the gem of the desert.  The market
is the hub of the city; all trade and commerce of any significance is
carried on here.  The market spreads out in all directions save east; here
Main Street heads for the eastern gate.

The Northeastern Market Square
  Pandemonium.  Chaos.  Madness.  A few other choice words come to mind as
you gaze into this corner of the market.  The vegetable stand seems quiet
enough so you have to assume the noise comes from the Butchery.  You have to
think for a while before you muster the will to enter this shop.  The market
continues to the south and west.

Sultan's Walk (768)

Sultan's Walk (767)

Sultan's Walk (766)

The Palace Gate (G)
  You stand before a magnificently crafted gate wrought in solid gold.  You
gape in awe at the splendor of the spiralling towers beyond the portal.  The
ruler of all the eastern lands resides in this fine palace, and he is not a
poor man.  The grand entrance lies beyond the gate, and Sultan's walk is to
the east.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east (west) ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 354/518 HP  395/553 MP  765/778 mv  476tnl  
Lv 17  G 44252 | The Palace Gate (EW)
>>
The Grand Entrance
  Nowhere have you seen such an obscene display of wealth than in this
corridor.  The shag carpeting under your feet makes it seem as if you are
walking on a cloud.  Platinum candelabras hang delicately from the ceiling
casting light on the ancient tapestries adorning the walls.  The crick in
your neck tells you it's time to stop staring.  To the west the numerous
halls of the palace begin and the gate lies to the east.  

<MAPEND>

Art Exhibit

victories in battle.  Strange sculptures rest on pedestals at each corner of

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Unforgiving Heat
  A high rocky outcropping provides a perfect wall blocking the stinging and 
grit of the recent desert sandstorm. Surprisingly, the air now is still, 
almost perfectly calm. But it is terribly hot and dry - stinking hot would be
an understatement. A long tall glass of water would be welcome but there is 
none to be had, unless a merciful djinn, eager to please, were to grant a 
wish.

away the sand further reveals what appears to be an opening of some kind.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

help moonbeam
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Moonbeam'.
Help Category : Attack Spell.
Related Helps : Sunray.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-20 17:31:50.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast 'moonbeam' <victim>
Damage: light
Spell Number: 144

With the use of this spell you conjure forth a beam of pure
moonlight which strikes your victim.  

Primary stat: Wisdom, Constitution.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

vc
-vconfig-  seperate multiple commands with | instead of ;

  -  [port]    Recall portal to use                     hold duffle;enter
  -  [wield]   Wielded weapon to use                    bow
  -  [dual]    Dual wielded weapon to use               bow
  -  [held]    Held item to return after using portals  candle
  -  [spellup] Spellup to use                           napalm;spellup
  -  [hpot]    Health potion to use                     relief
  -  [mpot]    Mana potion to use                       moonlight
  -  [vpot]    Moves potion to use                      refreshing
  -  [pbag]    Potions bag                              bag
  -  [portbag] Portals bag                              bag
  -  [bag]     General bag                              bag
  -  [attack1] Primary attack                           c 'earth maw'
  -  [attack2] Secondary attack                         kick
  -  [debuff1] First debuff                             ca poison
  -  [debuff2] Second debuff                            ca wither
  -  [cplvl]   Level to CP level until                  110
  -  [cpexp]   CP Level noexp toggle amount             400
  -  [group]   Group Frame Format until                 1
  -  [tdiff]   Time Difference from Mud Time            7
  -  [speak]   Speak audio alerts                       false

An icy, light wind blows from the northeast.

w
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Winger Go Cubs Go! Fly the [W]!.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Geysirjokull (736)

Approaching the Camp
  To the northeast, the snow-shrouded bulk of the long dormant volcano
dominates the horizon.  Even at this distance, the fearsome winds of the
upper slopes are made visible through the wisps of snow streaming from the
peak.  There are two constants in this frozen wasteland - the terrible cold,
so intense it easily penetrates clothing, flesh, sinew and bone, and the
wintry landscape, a pallid white as far as the eye can see.  Here and there
a skeletal tree, branches encased in ice, provides some small respite from
the dreary continuity.  A wide swath of snow has been tramped down by the
passing of dozens of booted feet.  It leads off to the east where a camp of
some sort can be seen, a trickle of rising smoke giving evidence of
habitation.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west ]

On a Windswept Trail (762)

At the Volcano's Summit (760)

The Rim of the Crater (758)

Within the Crater (756)

Within the Crater (754)

Before the Massive Gates
  Huge black gates loom over the scrawny adventurers, seeking the heat that
the volcano hides.  The slightly augmented temperature is the sole thing
that guides these poor half-frozen souls up here.  The gate is forbidding,
almost mocking in its severity and austerity.  Its sole purpose is to keep
those in need out.  To that end, two burly guards, wielding spears, stand
here and jeer at the pathetic sight the humans portray, occasionally jabbing
at them with their weapons.

Entryway to the City
  Carved deep into the side of the crater, this cavernous chamber is a
testament to the skill of dwarven excavators, engineers and artisans. 
Torches mounted in iron brackets illuminate the elaborately etched basalt
walls.  Depicted are what appear to be scenes of battle from throughout the
Swordbreaker clan's history.  In one tableau, Tbir Swordbreaker himself is
shown standing atop a mountain of corpses, holding high a gleaming gemstone.
An enormous flight of stone steps, stretching from one side of the chamber
to the next, descends into the volcano's depths.  To the west stand the
massive black gates, leading back to the crater and the brutal cold.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: west down ]

On a Busy Street (792)

A Sooty Street Corner
  The street enters from the west, runs round a corner and exits to the
north.  On the eastern side, a bricked over cave with only an opening for a
doorway, forms a makeshift dwarven house.  Perhaps not home to the
cleanliest of occupants, the wooden door bears a collection of sooty finger
and hand prints.  Nearby a worn hide ball, stitches loose and frayed, has
seen better days.  

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Barren Fields (790)

On the outskirts of a battlefield
  Stepping through a small opening in the woodline, you find yourself
standing on the outer edge of what looks like a huge battlefield.  Your
mouth drops and you stare at the scene before you.  Chairs, tables, brooms,
and various other household items are fighting against animals!  How can
this be, though?  Furniture does not move and it certainly does not fight,
and even stranger is that the animals seem to be working together and using
makeshift weapons!

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

GreyAsh Alley to Silvermist Road
  This is a gloomy sort of intersection where the ground and the air both hold 
a grey shade. There is little to see on the corner of GreyAsh Alley and 
Silvermist Road other than a large manor covered by a large, white tent.
Three massive cannons defend the front lawn, and a stable of warhorses sits 
off to the side. Funny, you think, how, with the grey of ash and the silver 
of mist, a war scene seems fitting. A massive chain dangles above you.

A room with a view! (Atop the platform)
  You made it, and the view is worth the effort! Peering into the distance you 
see mountain ranges, villages, and the green carpet of vast forests. The 
thrumming of enormous power vibrates through the platform, and apparently it 
keeps the platform and the entire prison above the clouds. The massive chain 
leads down, and a metal door leads up into the prison fortress. The only sign
of dragons here, despite the rumors, is the dragon scale anchoring the chain 
leading down.

Dark and forgotten
  
You drop lightly onto possibly the most filthy floor you've ever seen. The 
only illumination comes from your own light source, but it clearly outlines 
the many bones littering the tiny room. Surveying the room carefully, you 
notice that there is no ceiling above, and the only other exit besides the 
one you entered through is through a greasy trapdoor above.

The Magenta stripe on the wall glows faintly and you notice a little Magenta Sign.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

and Aardwolf's Discord channel https://discord.gg/KH62U8P

napalm (str and int buff)

CLAN: At-ten-tion! KumoGami is here to get some training done!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

At the entrance of the park (G)
  This is the entrance to the Park. To the east is a wide walkway of red brick,
leading to the shops and then to the Aquarium. Wrought iron benches have been
placed around the park for visitor's convenience. There are also trash 
receptacles for litter. A discreet bronze plaque is mounted to a small 
pillar.

Which way now?
  This is a four way intersection where two of the brick walkways intersect.
However, a barrier blocks the south, preventing you from continuing in that 
direction. A sign has been posted on the barrier. You can go east or north 
into the Park or back west and out through the gate.

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  To the west is the White
Elephant Souvenir & Gift shop and to the east are the park administration
offices.  Flower beds and privet hedges line the walkway, adding beauty as
well as defining the path and fencing off the grass.  

<MAPEND>

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  Shops open off of this
walkway to both the west and the east.  To the west is the Safari Outfitters

A turn in the busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  The walkway makes a turn to
the east and the south.  To the north is the entrance to the primate
exhibit.  Some of the land's most unusual primates are displayed there. 
Wrought iron benches have been placed at strategic intervals, beckoning
weary visitors to stop and rest.

In the Aviary
  This room is vast, with a very high ceiling.  The walls are made of panes
of thick, geenish glass, set into sturdy wrought iron frames.  It is humid,
and filled with trees and flowering bushes.  You can hear the calls of all
types of avians.  Bits of seed and fruit litter the floor.  
The door out is to the south.

<MAPEND>

Feline House
  Painted a soft coral, with a dark polished aggregate floor, this room is

different enclosure.  Each enclosure has a door.  Many people are wandering

feline viewing area.

Gryphon Enclosure

nest.

On a busy walkway (789)

A turn in the busy walkway (788)

A turn in the busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  The walkway makes a turn to
the east and the south.  To the north is the entrance to the primate
exhibit.  Some of the land's most unusual primates are displayed there. 
Wrought iron benches have been placed at strategic intervals, beckoning
weary visitors to stop and rest.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     This smallish egg is completely ordinary.

     A wrought iron trash container waits to be filled.

On a busy walkway

s
A turn in the busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  The walkway makes a turn to
the east and the south.  To the north is the entrance to the primate
exhibit.  Some of the land's most unusual primates are displayed there. 
Wrought iron benches have been placed at strategic intervals, beckoning
weary visitors to stop and rest.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
     This smallish egg is completely ordinary.
     This small bench has been intricately crafted of wrought iron.
     A wrought iron trash container waits to be filled.

[*Daily Blessing*] 512/545 HP  383/578 MP  789/795 mv  1136tnl  
Lv 18  G 64952 | A turn in the busy walkway (NESW)
>>
w
On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  Doors open off of this
walkway to both the north and the south.  To the north is the small mammal
habitat and to the south is the large mammal habitat.  Flower beds and
privet hedges line the walkway, adding beauty as well as defining the path
and fencing off the grass.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]

In the Aviary
  This room is vast, with a very high ceiling.  The walls are made of panes
of thick, geenish glass, set into sturdy wrought iron frames.  It is humid,
and filled with trees and flowering bushes.  You can hear the calls of all
types of avians.  Bits of seed and fruit litter the floor.  
The door out is to the south.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
An elderly gentleman enjoys a pipe of tobacco.
An emu searches for food.
A tiny, brightly colored finch flutters from branch to branch.

  Built to resemble a billabong, this enclosure is thick with vegetation.

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of

habitat and to the south is the large mammal habitat.  Flower beds and
privet hedges line the walkway, adding beauty as well as defining the path
and fencing off the grass.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east down ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) DobbyBobby the Barbarian.
(Player) (White Aura) Madrox kills everyone in 665 different ways.
(Player) (White Aura) (Linkdead) EmJay the Shaman.
[AFK] (Player) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical beds.
(Player) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.
[AFK] (Player) Roume wasn't built in a day. is sleeping on Medical beds.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.
Lepdar flies in from the east.

Lv 18  G 64978 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)

e
Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

[*Daily Blessing*] 25/545 HP  213/578 MP  792/795 mv  1532tnl  
Lv 18  G 64978 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve The Bod is resting here.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

s
Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

<MAPEND>

     A silver flail glints in an oddly evil way, like saliva on fangs.

( 2) A small glass holds a liquid of tantalizing aroma.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

At the entrance of the park (G)
  This is the entrance to the Park. To the east is a wide walkway of red brick,
leading to the shops and then to the Aquarium. Wrought iron benches have been
placed around the park for visitor's convenience. There are also trash 
receptacles for litter. A discreet bronze plaque is mounted to a small 
pillar.

different enclosure.  Each enclosure has a door.  Many people are wandering

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  Doors open off of this
walkway to both the west and the east.  To the west is the feline habitat
and to the east is the carnivore habitat.  Flower beds and privet hedges
line the walkway, adding beauty as well as defining the path and fencing off
the grass.

w
On the bridge over the flamingo pond
  This wooden bridge is built in the Oriental half-moon style, to span the 
flamingo pond. When the pool is still, the bridge and the reflection of the 
bridge form a perfect circle. Leaning over the edge, you can watch the 
flamingos as they search through the water for shrimp and other food. Their 
brilliant pink plummage stands out against the dark green of the water and 
reeds. The brick walkway leads away to the east and the west.

<MAPEND>

At the entrance of the park (G)

leading to the shops and then to the Aquarium. Wrought iron benches have been
placed around the park for visitor's convenience. There are also trash 
receptacles for litter. A discreet bronze plaque is mounted to a small 
pillar.

Administrative offices
  These are the administrative office for the Zoo.  This room is painted a
soft blue with dark gray carpeting underfoot.  Several straight back chairs
are aligned by the door.  Missy, the Administrator's efficient secretary, is
hard at work typing reports and ordering supplies.  The only task she does
not do here is the bookkeeping.  For some reason, the Administrator prefers
to do those himself.  Odd, because he really hates to work.

A turn in the busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of

the east and the south.  To the north is the entrance to the primate

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Charmed) A majestic and proud looking warhorse stands here.

At the entrance of the park (G)
  This is the entrance to the Park. To the east is a wide walkway of red brick,
leading to the shops and then to the Aquarium. Wrought iron benches have been
placed around the park for visitor's convenience. There are also trash 
receptacles for litter. A discreet bronze plaque is mounted to a small 
pillar.

On a busy walkway (782)

On a busy walkway (781)

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  Doors open off of this
walkway to both the east and the west.  To the east is the reptile habitat
and to the west is the children's petting zoo.  Flower beds and privet
hedges line the walkway, adding beauty as well as defining the path and
fencing off the grass.  

<MAPEND>

Salamander Enclosure
  This enclosure resembles the interior of a living volcano.  Pumice
cinders cover the floor, while all around the edges of the room are rocks of
obsidian and black granite.  A pool of magma is in the center of the room,
providing a place for the salamanders to play.

Wyvern Enclosure
  This enclose resembles a dark, dry cave.  The smooth floor is covered in
sand.  The walls are wide and the ceiling is very high.  The light from the
door only penetrates a few feet into the interior.  A smell reminiscent of
sulfur and burning metal permeates the room.  The air is hot, almost
searing.  Small bits of bone are visible in the sand.

The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

In a Temple of Sibi (G)
  You have entered the temple of Sibi, where the air is cooler and the incense 
lends a meditative quality to the air. Along the walls are great paintings 
and murals of intricate design, but one in particular catches your attention.
A vast mountain range with an endless forest at its feet shimmers as you look
upon it, beckoning you to take a closer look.

You step into a painting of a mountain range and arrive in...
Razor Spine Ridge
  Blinking in the bright sunlight, you find yourself high upon the slopes
of a vast mountain range and it seems that you are on the rim of the known 
worlds. The wind is chilling at this height and you have a wide view over the
lands below. Behind and to either side, the mountains disappear into the far 
horizon, while at your feet an endless vista of forest stretches on below you.
The mountains are impassable, but there is a trail of sorts leading down from
the jagged peaks and to the south, where the forest awaits.

<MAPEND>

The Forest of Teeth (788)

A tangle of trees (787)

The Forest of Teeth (786)

A small gully
  The forest floor takes a downward turn into a small gully. There is a small 
and stagnant lake at the bottom and it would appear that this gully becomes a 
natural dam in the heavy rains. The ground is damp and uneven, but solid enough 
to ensure firm footing. On the western side of the gully there is a rock face 
and perhaps an opening, but there are too many trees around to be sure. Trees
rise up on all sides of the small gully, but there seems to be a path to the 
south.

<MAPEND>

A fetid, subterranean chamber
  Having entered the hidden opening in the rock face, you find yourself in a
rocky underground chamber. This chamber is quite large and has many openings 
leading deeper into the mountains. A deep rumbling shakes the very stones 
around you and loose stones fall from the cavern roof in response. A loud 
bellowing roar erupts from one of the tunnels and echoes around you, leaving
you slightly stunned. Larger stones are knocked loose as, with terrifying 
speed, a giant worm leaps out of a tunnel, shaking the foundations of the 
chamber, challenging your presence in its home.

<MAPEND>

  This is the room where the Sultan keeps the beautiful women of his
palace.  There are ten girls here lying about the room dressed in silks you
can almost see through.  In the western end of the room stands a large mound
of pillows and a beautiful young maiden sits perched atop.  It is
unfortunate for you that only the Sultan is allowed in here.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Eastern Path
  The path meanders on its way to a charming little lake, both partially shaded
by leafy trees. The water is a clear blue, the surface reflecting milky white
clouds and blue skies. A small hut to the north is almost hidden from view by
the surrounding trees. The door is open, and you wonder who or what is 
inside.

Dense Wood
  The back door of the cabin was closed and locked for a reason, you discover, 
stepping over and around the thick brush and tree roots. The trees are huge, 
towering way above you and blocking out the sunlight. No birds sing here, and
everything is dark and gloomy. The path is to the east.

A Cabin on the Shore
  The remaining frames show that this was once a one-roomed cabin. All that 
stands now is the southern wall with a locked door. The northern and eastern 
walls are little more than posts holding up a roof of holes. Much of the 
pieces of wooden furniture have been broken a long time, and some look like 
they are used as scratching posts. The owner has either been away or just 
doesn't care about the establishment.

Western Shore of the Lake
  This side of the lake is cooly shaded by the leafy trees. The path continues 
to the north, towards the nesting grounds of the geese. The other side of the
lake is visible from where you stand, shaded by the trees as well. The water 
is a clear blue, the surface reflecting milky white clouds and blue skies.
Webbed footprints line the muddy shore, the waterfowl having walked all over 
the place.

Nesting Ground
  Step carefully or you will disturb the nesting geese. Several nests lined 
with grass are occupied, the geese watching you with their beaks under their

maybe you should leave their home.

e
Stepping-Stone Bridge
  A trail of rocks, worn smooth over the ages, links two shores of the lake, 
over the small river that runs from the mountains to the north. The flat 
rocks make a bridge where travellers can cross the waters, though the nesting
ground of the geese on the west side makes people a bit wary. A few of the 
rocks are submerged underwater slightly, raising the notch of danger in the 
crossing. There is a large rock at the eastern end of the bridge of stones.

<MAPEND>

Trickling River
  The Sen'narre mountains in the north loom in the distance, with a river 
flowing gently towards the lake. The water is a clear blue, pure and 
beautiful. Where the water reaches the lake, a line of stepping stones 
bridges the two shores.

Rock Outcropping
  Looks like you have to climb over this large rock. You must admit though, it 
makes a nice seat to look over the lake. The bridge of stepping stones allows
travellers to cross over the lake on the north end, though they must climb 
over this rock first. Down in the water, you can see the shapes of waterlife 
swimming below the surface. Perhaps one can even fish here. You can see a 
grassy clearing to the east, calm and peaceful.

Northern Path
  The path is but a small dirt trail lined with long grass. Songbirds chirp 
happily in the trees. There is a clearing to the southeast, where the deer 
graze. To reach the lake, you should leave to the south, but there is a large
rock obstructing the path. West of you is the Sen'narre river.

  At your entrance, the startled deer leap away into the forest to hide amid

Grassy Clearing
  At your entrance, the startled deer leap away into the forest to hide amid 
the trees. The tall grass sways along with the breeze, tickling you as you 
wade through the field. To the north, rocks rise to form the cliffs of Twin 
Peaks Valley.

Northern Path
  The path is but a small dirt trail lined with long grass. Songbirds chirp 
happily in the trees. There is a clearing to the southeast, where the deer

rock obstructing the path. West of you is the Sen'narre river.

[*Daily Blessing*] 449/545 HP  483/578 MP  762/795 mv  1145tnl

s
Rock Outcropping
  Looks like you have to climb over this large rock. You must admit though, it 
makes a nice seat to look over the lake. The bridge of stepping stones allows
travellers to cross over the lake on the north end, though they must climb 
over this rock first. Down in the water, you can see the shapes of waterlife 
swimming below the surface. Perhaps one can even fish here. You can see a 
grassy clearing to the east, calm and peaceful.

<MAPEND>

     A good place to sit on the rock is unoccupied.

w
s
Stepping-Stone Bridge
  A trail of rocks, worn smooth over the ages, links two shores of the lake, 
over the small river that runs from the mountains to the north. The flat 
rocks make a bridge where travellers can cross the waters, though the nesting
ground of the geese on the west side makes people a bit wary. A few of the 
rocks are submerged underwater slightly, raising the notch of danger in the 
crossing. There is a large rock at the eastern end of the bridge of stones.

<MAPEND>

Around the Lake
  The path circling the lake ends here, interrupted by the flow of water. The 
surface reflects milky white clouds and blue skies, and is dotted with a few 
lily pads here and there. The shore is very muddy, and you must be wary of 
where you step in case the ground deceives and you end up in the water.

here.

Muddy Waters
  The water is disgustingly muddy here. The muck sticks to everything you wear,
seeping into your clothing. You are up to your waist in the water, trying to 
wade through the muck to some sort of solid ground, hopefully dry. The 
floating mud deceives you once again as you try to climb up.

<MAPEND>

d
Sinking in Muddy Water
  The water clears up some as you sink deeper. Although the water is still 
brown and muddy, you can actually see things around you now instead of a wall
of mud. Small dark-colored fish swim away as you disturb their homes in the 
mud, swimming towards safety in the deeper reaches of the lake.

<MAPEND>

Sinking in Muddy Water
  The water clears up some as you sink deeper. Although the water is still 
brown and muddy, you can actually see things around you now instead of a wall
of mud. Small dark-colored fish swim away as you disturb their homes in the 
mud, swimming towards safety in the deeper reaches of the lake.

Before the Light
  Blue light radiates from the floating orb before you, shining upon you with 
surprising warmth. It is a thing of beauty, perfectly spherical and of an 
unfamiliar power and light. You feel at peace in this place, the feeling most
likely given by the strange powers of the large orb floating calmly above a 
stone pedestal. You wonder how the tritons have come across such a thing.

Dwelling of the Elder
  The cave is small and expectedly sparsely decorated. The walls are smooth, 
and drawings of ink cover all directions, even the roof of the cave. You are 
not sure how the ink can stay in the water and not disappear, but there is 
definitely magic in this place. A familiar blue ball of light floats above in
the center of the cave, illuminating everything around it. A simple mat of 
seaweed lies upon the whole of the floor, where the elder sits, awaiting you.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

A Ferocious Sandstorm (G)
  A sudden barrage of flying sand grains makes it hard to see which way
to go next.  Just keeping a straight unblinking gaze is next to impossible,
let alone finding a way forward.  Staying, though, would mean a change in
career from adventurer to sculpture.  Better find a way out of this storm
fast.

------------------------------------------------------------
You step into the archway, but the floor dissolves beneath you!
------------------------------------------------------------
Unforgiving Heat
  A high rocky outcropping provides a perfect wall blocking the stinging and 
grit of the recent desert sandstorm. Surprisingly, the air now is still, 
almost perfectly calm. But it is terribly hot and dry - stinking hot would be
an understatement. A long tall glass of water would be welcome but there is 
none to be had, unless a merciful djinn, eager to please, were to grant a 
wish.

<MAPEND>

An Endless Sea of Sand (G) (675)

On Strange Ground
  Sand has accumulated here in an unnaturally symmetrical pattern, forming
a circular mound.  Climbing the mound with little difficulty, you can see
that the surface seems to be part of a construction of some kind.  Brushing
away the sand further reveals what appears to be an opening of some kind.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Mesolarian Grassland (688)

A Cobblestone Path
  A well-laid road lies here, acting as a path to service the sewers of
Aylor.  With the passing years, grass has poked its head through the
cobblestone, as the forest reclaims its seized land.  In some parts, the
grass is so thick that it is difficult to follow the path for more than a
few feet ahead.

The Forest of Illusions (698)

The Forest of Illusions
  As you become more accustomed to the forest by exploring, the more the
forest lives up to its reputation.  The trees start to blend.  The trails
twist and turn.  And the sounds of the forest become consistent throughout
every inch of the forest.  Soon, there are no more differences in the
forest, and it becomes totally indistinguishable.  

<MAPEND>

n
A Large Tree
  After searching the forest of illusions for some time, the canopy of the
forest opens, allowing the tallest tree in the forest through.  The light
pours in from the sky, illuminating what appears to be a very large grey
mound hanging from the massive trunk.  As you stare at the grey sphere, you
notice that it is vibrating slightly, and a barely audible buzzing sound is
coming from within.

The Great Eastern Desert (656)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is

[*Daily Blessing*] 541/545 HP  569/578 MP  785/785 mv  1279tnl  
Lv 18  G 67967 | KumoGami's Manor (S)
>>
s
Before a Castle of Spiders
   As you step into this section of the forest, you notice a continuous line of
 spiders all moving on the same path. It seems very odd... 
 
 Looking in the direction of the path, you notice a road that leads to a
 clearing in the forest. 

 In the clearing is a large castle. Examining the shape of the castle, you
 notice the pinnacles of the towers almost seem like... sharp ends of spider
 legs. Now that you think of it, the entire castle seems as if it was made to be
 shaped like an enormous spider buried in the ground. It must be at least 100ft
 tall. In the front of the castle, you see a cat guarding the entrance.

[*Daily Blessing*] 545/545 HP  578/578 MP  785/785 mv  1279tnl  
Lv 18  G 67967 | KumoGami's Manor (S)
>>
WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

The Great Eastern Desert (732)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Great Eastern Desert (735)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

A long corridor

Chamber Entrance
  You stand at the entrance to a large hall.  By the number of statues and
other religious carvings and paraphenalia scattered about the hall, you
would guess that this was used as a place of worship by the members of the
religion who built this temple.  Further to the south you think you can see
three large statues, but you would have to go closer to see what they were. 
The hall extends out to either side of you, and also to the south.  An
archway to the north leads out onto a small landing.

Chamber Entrance
  You stand at the entrance to a large hall.  By the number of statues and
other religious carvings and paraphenalia scattered about the hall, you
would guess that this was used as a place of worship by the members of the
religion who built this temple.  Further to the south you think you can see

w


Northwest Corner
  You stand in the north-west corner of the chamber of worship.  The hall
extends into the darkness to the east, and also to the south, where you can
make out vague shapes.  Rotting benches covered in dust are arranged in
rows, where the devout used to sit and pray to their depraved Gods.  You
shiver as a chill seems to pass through you, perhaps the faded power of
those same Gods still lingers here?  

<MAPEND>
