e
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east down ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) DobbyBobby the Barbarian.
[AFK] (Player) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical beds.
(Player) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

[*Daily Blessing*] 25/545 HP  93/578 MP  784/785 mv  1859tnl  
Lv 18  G 68231 | Medical lounge (ED)
>>
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Lepdar is here.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Breathe in, Breathe out..
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Infirmary (G)
  Oh no it looks like the perils of Aardwolf have overcome you and you have 
fallen in battle. No worries though it looks like your fellow soldiers were 
able to recover your body and resurrect your spirit. It's a strange feeling 
seeing your body on the ground. IMPORTANT: Make sure you loot everything 
off your corpse and it decomposes before you leave the room! Sometimes
you might have issues seeing the invisible objects on your corpse. You can 
buy a detect invisibility potion from our shop run s3e from here and type 
list. Also don't be afraid to ask for a miracle on clantalk. If it works 
it could help restore some of your lost experience. The Medical Lounge is 
south from here in case you need a healer.

<MAPEND>

     (Invis) (Magic) (Glow) The Druids have provided you with the Auspices of the Druids to aid your
journey.

Social output for clap.
<1> - You clap your hands together.
<2> - <player> shows <his/her/their> approval by clapping <his/her/their> hands together.
<3> - You clap at <his/her/their> performance.
<4> - <player> claps at <target's> performance.
<5> - <player> claps at your performance.
<6> - You clap at your own performance.
<7> - <player> claps at <his/her/their> own performance.

shelp group

Social output for groupheal.
<1> - You pause, thinking to yourself about how you'd like a little 'group and heal' action.
<2> - <player> looks quite flushed, <he/she/they> must be thinking about some 'group and heal'
action.
<3> - With a winning smile you ask <target> if <he/she/they>'d like to 'group and heal'.
<4> - You overhear <player> smoothly ask <target> "How you doin?". Looks like some 'group and heal'
action.
<5> - <player> walks up to you and smoothly asks, "How would you like to join me in a little 'group
and heal' action?"
<6> - It's kind of important that you bring someone else if you want to 'group and heal'.
<7> - <player> is trying to 'group and heal' with <him/her/them>self, maybe you should leave the
room.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

  Trade Boulevard ends here, and Royalty Row begins.  This road leads up
a large hill to an elaborate mansion that overlooks the entire island. 
Tall trees grow along the side of the road, and tulips of all colors
circle each tree along this road.  Plush grass grows in between the trees
and a few park benches have been placed along the road for weary
travelers.

Gideon's Pet Shop
  This isn't an ordinary pet shop.  There are no cages, only space for the
animals to roam freely.  Birds are flying through the air, monkeys are
playing on ropes that have been rigged up from the ceiling for swinging
purposes, and fish are swimming in a large pond that has been built into the
floor.  Many different types of animals live in perfect harmony here.  The
room is very large in size and although the animals roam freely, the shop is
very clean.  There are several different types of potted plants for the
animals to enjoy, including a few small trees for the birds to nest in.  The
animals here have all been hand raised and well taken care of.

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Silverwind Forest (756)

Calm waters
  The waters of Aphasia flow right past the southernmost tip of Minos here.
White capped waves crash against the bleached sand, and the light misty sea
spray adds to the chill in the air.  An oppressive gloom hangs over the
area, and though the sun shines, it gives no warmth.  Yet the waters here
are calm and subdued, as though they have had a long voyage and finally
returned home.  The light breeze upon your cheek contains a slight wiff of
burnt wood.  The smell appears to come from the far east where Melchos, the
ruined keep, stands.  North from here, the ground turns from white sand to
blackened, rocky soil.  

<MAPEND>

The young dwarf standing here sobs softly, tears dripping into a growing puddle in the dirt.

Krimzar (Recruit) tells the CLAN: 'dang I hate when the cp hits you with a ton mobs :P'

n
A narrow land bridge
  You have stepped from a land of peace into what seems to be a nightmare. 
As soon as you passed from the mainland to this narrow bridge of land, which
connects Minos with the rest of Mesolar your senses are assaulted. 
Visually, though there is plenty of light, a gloom seems to fall over
everything, casting it in a dimmer light.  The smells of death and smoke
are thick in the air, and here, next to the rolling sea, the scent of spray
mixes unpleasantly with the foul odors.  The sounds of screaming and moaning
come to your ears, though the sound is hollow and seems like it should be
distant.  The land here is still green, the trees which grow along the sandy
beaches on either side of this narrow strip of land are tall and evenly
spaced along the coastline.  The mist from the sea spray brushes against
your skin, and there is a hint of chill coming from farther east.  Is it
really wise to enter into this nightmare?  The rumors told in many inns warn
of going to Minos in search of Asterion's treasure, and all the fragments of
stories in the libraries tell of how the land rose up to curse those
involved in the mindless slaughter.  They also mention that any who seek to
profit from that long ago blood bath are in danger themselves of becoming
trapped in the curse of the land.  Perhaps they are just rumors, but there
could be a lot to gain from just trying.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east south ]
An elven warrior's spirit lingers here.

[*Daily Blessing*] 545/545 HP  578/578 MP  753/785 mv  1859tnl  
Lv 18  G 62313 | A narrow land bridge (NES)
>>
e
n
A foul beach
  The sea breeze on this shore feels like a clinging putrid wind.  You
smell fear, death and hatred all rolled into one.  It assails your very senses
and weaves its way into your armor, seeking to tear you apart, limb from
limb.  The waves crash against the rocks and boulders with a vengeance and
fury, setting up sea sprays a few meters high.  The water feels stinging and
warm, akin to that of a hot spring.  Yet, you feel a foulness that makes your
skin crawl.  It would not be wise to drink from these waters.  Northwards,
the shore opens out into a field, while the entrance to Minos lies to the
west.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 545/545 HP  578/578 MP  752/785 mv  1859tnl  
Lv 18  G 62313 | A foul beach (NW)
>>
w
The edge of an ancient battlefield
  The ground is still torn and broken from a battle long ago.  Twisted
stumps rear up from the rocky soil and small, twisted trees reach skeletal
branches toward the sky.  A sense of oppression fills the area and even in
brightest sunlight a gloom hangs over the field.  Bits of broken and
battered armor litter the area, most showing signs of rust.  The stench of
decay is all around, and blackened bones are scattered around the broken
stumps that dot this section of the battlefield.  The sounds of hollow
moans and screams can be heard from every direction, and flickers of ghostly
movement tease the edges of your vision; here a Reman Legionnaire thrusting
his sword into a small Minotaur child, there a large bestial Minotaur
hacking into the body of an Elven archer.  This is truly not a place of
happiness.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north south west ]

A minotaur spirit is reliving its last days.

[*Daily Blessing*] 545/545 HP  578/578 MP  750/785 mv  1859tnl  
Lv 18  G 62313 | The edge of an ancient battlefield (NSW)
>>
n
Shattered ground
  Deep wounds seem to have been made in the earth in this area.  It looks
as if some mighty giant has taken an axe and chopped into the ground in
several places.  The mountains cast a shadow over the lands to the north,
and large boulders dot the landscape.  The smell of salt is in the air, but
this soothing scent of the sea is offset by the acrid smell of smoke and the
stench of death.  The ground seems to be in a continuous state of decay. 
Rocks and soil slip and slide with no encouragement at all.  A long,
forelorn cry echoes off the nearby mountains as a misty minotaur female
cradles the broken and bloody body of a child, whose horns were just starting
to sprout.  A man on horseback materializes from nowhere and charges the
Minotaur.  He runs her through with his lance just before a bloodied form
charges across the broken ground, ripping the horse's stomach open with a
blood stained horn.  The misty images flicker and change constantly.  Faint
screams of pain and triumph follow them.  A chill enters the air and it
seems that even the sun's light is forbidden to warm the land.  

<MAPEND>

>>
A Peaceful Mountain (G)
  Climbing a small way up this mountain you are granted a moment of solace
from the ghostly figures prowling below.  The ground here is rocky, yet
unspoiled.  It looks as if the fighting never reached this far.  Attempting
to climb further up you realize the terrain becomes impassable, the slope
almost vertical in places.  To the east you see what looks like some sort of
naval base, and raising your eyes further you see a towering keep in the
distance.  Back to the south you are reminded of the land bridge you crossed
to enter this place.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: east south ]

[*Daily Blessing*] 545/545 HP  578/578 MP  748/785 mv  1859tnl  
Lv 18  G 62313 | A Peaceful Mountain (ES)

e
e
Amongst the spirits
  Tufts of grass grow sparsely in this area, fed by moisture from the sea. 
The ground is littered with fragments of bone and metal, and the remains of
a shattered building are near the coastline.  The stench of decay mixed with
the salty smell of the sea creates an unpleasant mixture that goes well with
the howls and shrieks surrounding you.  An oppressive gloom that is sensed
more than heard seems to have a weight, holding you in this area.  Ghostly
figures are everywhere.  Some have bodies torn and broken, while others
scream with bloodlust and hatred.  They beckon to you to join their fight. 
It is impossible not to brush against the thickly clustered spirits as they
relive the struggle fought so long ago.  

<MAPEND>

e
Remains of a ruined garrison
  A wrecked naval base stands forlornly by the shore.  It used to serve
Minos as a garrison to deter invasion from the southwest.  The combined
strength of the forces of good trampled over it, leaving nothing alive
behind.  You see ghostly figures coming out from the collapsed entrance. 
Their insubstantial uniforms marking them as former officers.  They stand
silently gazing at you with their hollow eyes.  Northwards and westwards,
the lands open into fields and you hear the distant cries of a raging
battle.  

<MAPEND>

The ghost of an elvish archer shoots arrows as quickly as he can.
An elvish zombie reaches for you, trying to curse you to wander forever.

[*Daily Blessing*] 429/545 HP  507/578 MP  784/785 mv  1705tnl  
Lv 18  G 62395 | Remains of a ruined garrison (NW)
>>
n
In the middle of a battle
  The surrounding area is nearly blocked from view by the sheer number of
spirits struggling in their endless fight.  All around are the hollow sounds
of screaming and a distant clashing of arms.  As you gaze around, you see a
large minotaur go down under a rain of Elven arrows; Oddly enough, the
minotaur has no weapon, but instead is carrying a small minotaur child.  A
Reman in blood-spattered armor materializes before you, and screams about
vengeance.  He slides his spear through the ribs of a red-furred minotaur
youth who is whirling a woodaxe in his hands.  The ground seems to still be
stained by the blood spilled here.  Glints of metal can be seen, half
covered by the centuries of dust and grime.  It is no wonder why people
would seek treasure here.

"run s"
run s
Remains of a ruined garrison
  A wrecked naval base stands forlornly by the shore.  It used to serve
Minos as a garrison to deter invasion from the southwest.  The combined
strength of the forces of good trampled over it, leaving nothing alive
behind.  You see ghostly figures coming out from the collapsed entrance. 
Their insubstantial uniforms marking them as former officers.  They stand
silently gazing at you with their hollow eyes.  Northwards and westwards,
the lands open into fields and you hear the distant cries of a raging
battle.  

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north west ]
The ghost of an elvish archer shoots arrows as quickly as he can.
An elvish zombie reaches for you, trying to curse you to wander forever.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Outskirts
  Breaking through the tree line, you come across an immense field.  Way
off in the distance you see what appears to be some type of tower.  However
it is like nothing you have ever seen before.  While the base appears to be
a mountain, layers have been transformed into different shapes as it rises
upwards disappearing into the clouds.  The adventurer's spirit within you is
aroused.  Sounds of fighting filter up to greet you.  An urge to practice
your new skills spurs you forward.

The Outskirts
  In the distance the fabled Spyre stands majestically reaching to the clouds.
You stand in awe, quietly contemplating the peaceful beauty surrounding you.
Birds call and swoop gracefully from the treetops, flitting carelessly around
your head. A light breeze blows, and you breathe deeply the scent of nature 
wafting around you.

In Spyre's Shadow
  Standing in the shadow of the Spyre a chill seeps into your bones. There must
be an entrance somewhere. But the walls of the Spyre are smooth and seamless.
Not a crack, not a handle nor a hinge can be found. Standing back, you look 
up, and up. The Spyre reaches up so high into the sky that its tip breaks 
through the clouds.

<MAPEND>

e
A Rock Fissure
  As you approach the massive rock base, a wide fissure becomes visible. 
From within, various sounds grow louder, sending a wave of excitement through
your veins.  Clashing of metal and muted voices seem to be just ahead.  What
is it?  A creature waiting to attack or an ally?  You summon your courage to
overcome your fear.  Grasping the chance to gain valuable experience at this
early stage of your journey, onward you go.

>>
In Spyre's Shadow
  Standing in the shadow of the Spyre a chill seeps into your bones. There must
be an entrance somewhere. The walls of the Spyre are smooth, hard and cold to
the touch. But somehow, they emit a powerful vibration that resonates through
your body. You quickly withdraw your hand, afraid to search further by touch.
Standing back, and looking up, you marvel and wonder how this great edifice 
was engineered.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: south west ]
A lightning bug flies free after escaping from the miner's lanterns.
A lightning bug flies free after escaping from the miner's lanterns.

The Outskirts
  In the distance the fabled Spyre stands majestically reaching to the clouds.
Its walls glisten brightly against the darkening sky. What might its secrets 
be, what knowledge does it hold? Only by exploring and reaching its pinnacle,
can answers be found.

The Outskirts
  Breaking through the tree line, you come across an immense field.  Way
off in the distance you see what appears to be some type of tower.  However
it is like nothing you have ever seen before.  While the base appears to be
a mountain, layers have been transformed into different shapes as it rises
upwards disappearing into the clouds.  The adventurer's spirit within you is
aroused.  Sounds of fighting filter up to greet you.  An urge to practice
your new skills spurs you forward.

A Rock Fissure
  As you approach the massive rock base, a wide fissure becomes visible. 
From within, various sounds grow louder, sending a wave of excitement through
your veins.  Clashing of metal and muted voices seem to be just ahead.  What
is it?  A creature waiting to attack or an ally?  You summon your courage to
overcome your fear.  Grasping the chance to gain valuable experience at this
early stage of your journey, onward you go.

Waterfall
  The feeling of magic in the land pervades. Turning the corner you spy a 
waterfall more beautiful than any you have ever seen, ending in a peaceful 
pond. Across the pond a series of stones like steps lead to the waterfall.
The waterfall doesn't feed the pond but actually runs backward! Looking 
closer at the waterfall you can see the steps continue up its height winding
back and forth through the spray. Having gone this far you eagerly step 
forward to see what might be next.

strange and you wonder what it could possibly mean. The leaves are large and 
fanlike in appearance. They wave silently at you as you pass by.

<MAPEND>

Giant Tree
  Stumbling around in confusion you happen upon a giant tree.  The branches

relative peace was a welcome break, the thirst for knowledge proves too
great to pass up.

n
Vine Covered Path
  Vines twist and curl as if alive. They line the pathway making walking 
hazardous. Roots rise up, in ropey knots, maliciously tripping you as you try
to navigate through the rain forest. The hanging vines almost seem like they 
would be a better mode of transportation, given the rough going along the 
ground.

>>
Cannibal Village
  You have stumbled upon a village.  As you look around at the huts you
notice they are of simple construction.  Grass mats line the floors.  The
sides are open to allow whatever breeze through that might pass by.  The
roofs are thatched grass and waterproof to keep out the ever present rain. 
There appears to be no rhyme or reason to how the huts are positioned in the
village.  To the south is one that is set apart from the others.  

<MAPEND>

Witchdoctor's Hut
  Although this hut appears to be like all the others with grass mats
lining the floor, open sides and a thatched roof to keep out the ever
present rain, you sense there is a more sinister purpose to the containers
that line the shelves.  Maybe this isn't the place you want to be when the
inhabitant returns.  A hasty retreat seems to be in order!

[*Daily Blessing*] 375/545 HP  491/578 MP  719/785 mv  1311tnl  
Lv 18  G 62486 | Pit Trap (none)

WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

The Outskirts
  Breaking through the tree line, you come across an immense field.  Way
off in the distance you see what appears to be some type of tower.  However
it is like nothing you have ever seen before.  While the base appears to be
a mountain, layers have been transformed into different shapes as it rises
upwards disappearing into the clouds.  The adventurer's spirit within you is
aroused.  Sounds of fighting filter up to greet you.  An urge to practice
your new skills spurs you forward.  

<MAPEND>

Rock Face
  A sheer wall to the north hampers your progress in that direction.
Claustrophobia could soon set in, given the narrow passageways drilled 
through the stalactites and stalagmites. Turning around, you begin to head 
back the way you came. But wait! A fresh breeze from the east draws your 
attention.

A Rock Fissure
  As you approach the massive rock base, a wide fissure becomes visible. 
From within, various sounds grow louder, sending a wave of excitement through
your veins.  Clashing of metal and muted voices seem to be just ahead.  What
is it?  A creature waiting to attack or an ally?  You summon your courage to
overcome your fear.  Grasping the chance to gain valuable experience at this
early stage of your journey, onward you go.

e
Waterfall
  The feeling of magic in the land pervades. Turning the corner you spy a 
waterfall more beautiful than any you have ever seen, ending in a peaceful 
pond. Across the pond a series of stones like steps lead to the waterfall.
The waterfall doesn't feed the pond but actually runs backward! Looking 
closer at the waterfall you can see the steps continue up its height winding
back and forth through the spray. Having gone this far you eagerly step 
forward to see what might be next.

<MAPEND>

Cannibal Village
  You have stumbled upon a village.  As you look around at the huts you
notice they are of simple construction.  Grass mats line the floors.  The
sides are open to allow whatever breeze through that might pass by.  The
roofs are thatched grass and waterproof to keep out the ever present rain. 
There appears to be no rhyme or reason to how the huts are positioned in the
village.  To the south is one that is set apart from the others.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>
[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) (Linkdead) Viridi said they'd never tier.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

shelp ear

Social output for earwave.
<1> - You wave your ears in tense attention.
<2> - <player> waves <his/her/their> ears in tense attention.
<3> - You wave your ears towards <target>, trying to listen carefully.
<4> - <player> waves <his/her/their> ears towards <target>, trying to listen carefully.
<5> - <player> waves <his/her/their> ears towards you, trying to listen carefully.
<6> - You wave your ears rapidly. Damn, it's hot here!
<7> - It's getting cold.. <player>, stop waving your ears!
Usage this reboot : 1 0 (player/mob)
Created by        : Stok

Line numbers correspond to those listed in 'HELP NEW SOCIAL'.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

<MAPEND>

(Player) Krimzar the Blacksmith.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

<MAPEND>

The Great Eastern Desert (776)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.

being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.
